using iq tree to generate consensus trees based on phyluce output

following this [IQ tree tutorial](https://iqtree.github.io/doc/Tutorial)

will need to [install IQ tree](https://iqtree.github.io/) and adjust file path as needed for IQ tree location (I was using v3.0.1)

to determine tree model, run model finder plus (MFP)

*75p v2*

```{bash}
/Users/meganewing/Desktop/robertslab/ch1/iqtree/iqtree3  \
-s ../data/phyluce/taxon-set1/mafft-nexus-internal-trimmed-gblocks-clean-75p_v2-raxmlmafft-nexus-internal-trimmed-gblocks-clean-75p_v2-raxml.phylip \
-m MFP
```

```{bash}
# run iq tree with model (-m) defined by MFP
# 1000 bootstraps and 1000 alrt iterations
# outgroups gcf_000002075,gcf_000327385,gcf_003073045

/Users/meganewing/Desktop/robertslab/ch1/iqtree/iqtree3  \
-s ../data/phyluce/taxon-set1/mafft-nexus-internal-trimmed-gblocks-clean-75p_v2-raxmlmafft-nexus-internal-trimmed-gblocks-clean-75p_v2-raxml.phylip \
-m GTR+F+I+R3 \
-bb 1000 \
-alrt 1000 \
-o gcf_000002075,gcf_000327385,gcf_003073045 \
-bnni \
-nt AUTO \
-redo
```
